plugins.name: Dummy Details Filler
plugins.description:
A Figma plugin that helps you populate your designs with dummy data. Unlike other data generators, this plugin gives you precise control over your generated content through customizable options for each data type. This is perfect for mockups, prototypes, and design presentations.


Data Types:

  1. Generate various types of realistic data:
  2. Full Names (International names from different cultures)
  3. Usernames (Customizable patterns)
  4. Email Addresses (Custom domains and formats)
  5. Phone Numbers (US, UK, France, Germany, Sri Lanka formats)
  6. Physical Addresses
  7. Company Names
  8. Job Titles
  9. Dates (Short, Long, ISO, European formats)
  10. Numbers (Custom ranges)
  11. Lorem Ipsum (Custom length)
  12. Passwords (Adjustable length and complexity)
  13. File Names (Various types and extensions)
  14. Domain Names
  15. IP Addresses
  16. Color Codes (HEX, RGB, HSL)
  17. Zip/Postal Codes (US, UK, Canada formats)
  18. Cities (Global selection)
  19. Countries
  20. UUID
  21. Prices (Multiple currencies and formats)
  22. Account Numbers
  23. Currency Symbols & Codes
  24. URL-friendly Slugs


Each data type comes with its own set of customization options, allowing you to generate exactly the kind of data you need for your designs. Whether you're creating a simple contact list or a complex dashboard, Dummy Details Filler helps you create more realistic and meaningful mockups quickly and efficiently.


Made with ❤️ by Yasir Ahamad
plugins.tagline: Fill your designs with dummy data instantly with more control!

plugins.name: Import/Export and manager variables - Lazy Variables
plugins.description:
Lazy variables is plugin that allows you to import/export multiple collections in variables and connect with remote collections from the team library. It enables seamless integration with shared design tokens, ensuring consistency across projects and teams.


Additionally, the tool helps you quickly search for variables, modify any value, and manage each variable individually. By streamlining the process of updating and maintaining design tokens, codeSyntax, it enhances collaboration, improves workflow efficiency, and optimizes your design process.
plugins.tagline: Import/Export variable collections, connecting to team libraries, and managing variables easily.

plugins.name: Recent frames
plugins.description:
Work faster by quickly navigating back to the frames you recently worked on. The plugin displays a small window with a history of Figma frames you clicked. You can use the back button to quickly go to your last frames. Only top-level frames are listed; nested frames are ignored.


Features:

  1. Back button to quickly navigate to a previously selected frame.
  2. List of recent frames: a single click centers the frame in your view, while a double-click auto-fits the zoom.
  3. Light and dark mode with native Figma UI style.
  4. Menu with special actions: quickly jump to the selected node in your local main component or select the same child node in all component instances.


Why I Created It:

I built this plugin because I work on complex Figma prototypes. I often need to copy something from a distant frame and then jump back to where I was working. I sometimes forget where I was in the project. I wanted a simple way to undo and return to my previous spot without any hassle.


Use Cases:

  1. Effortlessly undo your navigation by returning to the last frame you clicked.
  2. Quickly jump between components and your working frames.
  3. Present your design flows without manual panning and zooming.
plugins.tagline: Instantly jump to your last frames with a back button

plugins.name: Stellar - Streamline Your Design Handoff
plugins.description:
Stellar 🚀 empowers you to create organized and professional documentation for your design handoff. With four robust tools, you can structure your Figma files in a clean and intuitive manner.


Frame Identifier - Ideal for pinpointing specific screens or components.

Easily create clear headers to identify individual frames:

  1. Select any frame or group of elements.
  2. Add a title and subtitle.
  3. A polished header will be generated above your selection, enhancing clarity and organization.


Section Identifier - Perfect for grouping features or user flows.

Organize related frames with cohesive section headers:

  1. Select multiple frames that belong together.
  2. Add a section title and description.
  3. A header will be created that spans across all selected frames, providing a unified view.


Flow Identifier - Essential for tracking progress and communicating state.

Document your navigation flows with intuitive status indicators:

  1. Select frames within your user flow.
  2. Add a title and description.
  3. Choose a status (e.g., In Progress, Ready for Development).
  4. Status tags are color-coded and include helpful icons, making it easy to convey the current state.



Connector Arrows - Connect your frames with intelligent arrows.

Seamlessly link frames with dynamic arrows:

  1. Select two or more frames to connect.
  2. Choose from 4 arrow styles: Default Arrow (clean and simple), Success Arrow (positive flows), Error Arrow (error states), Dashed Arrow (alternative paths).
  3. Toggle between light and dark modes for optimal visibility.
  4. Arrows automatically adjust to frame positions, ensuring a tidy and logical layout.


Perfect for:

  1. Design Systems
  2. User Flow Documentation
  3. Development Handoff
  4. Project Status Tracking
  5. Team Collaboration



Start organizing your Figma files with Stellar and create documentation that both designers and developers will appreciate! 🚀🚀🚀
plugins.tagline: Streamline your design handoff with organized headers, sections, and smart connectors

plugins.name: Manekko
plugins.description:
Manekkoを起動した後、作業を行っているページで更新したいFrameを選択し、「実行」ボタンをクリックします。

すると、「master」という名前のページ内で、選択したFrameと同じ名前のFrameが置換されます。


開発者との連携や最新データの管理に役立てていただけると嬉しいです。


----


After starting Manekko, select the Frame you want to update on the page you are working on and click the "Run" button.

This will replace the Frame with the same name as the selected Frame in the page named "master".


We hope you find it useful in collaborating with developers and managing the latest data.
plugins.tagline: 素早くFrameの置換を行えます

plugins.name: GIFtastic
plugins.description:
🎬 GIFtastic - Turn Your Figma Frames Into Animated GIFs

Transform your Figma designs into captivating animated GIFs with just a few clicks! Perfect for showcasing UI interactions, creating marketing assets, or sharing design concepts.


✨ Key Features

  1. Smart & Simple
  2. Select frames and preview your animation in real-time
  3. Drag & drop to reorder frames
  4. One-click export with automatic downloads


Professional Quality

  1. 4 quality levels (64-256 colours)
  2. Multiple background options (transparent, white, black, or frame fill)
  3. Advanced dithering for smooth gradients
  4. Real-time file size preview


Complete Control

  1. Adjustable frame timing (0.05-5 seconds)
  2. Loop settings and playback controls
  3. Live preview with play/pause
  4. Memory-efficient processing


🚀 Perfect For

  1. UI/UX Designers: Showcase app interactions and user flows
  2. Marketing Teams: Create engaging social media content
  3. Product Teams: Demonstrate features and functionality
  4. Anyone: Who wants to make their designs move!


🎯 How It Works

  1. Select your frames in Figma
  2. Preview your animation with real-time playback
  3. Adjust quality, timing, and background settings
  4. Reorder frames by dragging if needed
  5. Export and download your GIF instantly


Ready to bring your designs to life? Install GIFtastic and start creating engaging animated stories from your Figma frames!
plugins.tagline: Transform your Figma designs into captivating animated GIFs with just a few clicks!

plugins.name: Ripplix - Animation Library
plugins.description:
Ripplix — friction-free design hand-off with motion

Skip the time-consuming prototypes and pin real-world interactions straight onto your Figma file.

Ripplix already has a curated library of 1 500 + micro-interactions from 300 + live apps & sites into an easy-to-search sidebar. One click drops a comment tag on the exact UI element (button, card, tab…) and links to a full-screen preview on ripplix.com so developers instantly see how it should feel—timing, easing, choreography and all.


Why you’ll use it every hand-off

  1. Contextual pins – Each animation is attached as a Figma comment on the layer you select, so engineers don’t have to hunt for it.
  2. Real-app reference – Every clip comes from production UIs, giving devs proven motion patterns instead of speculative mocks.
  3. Search that speaks UX – Filter by platform (Web, iOS, Android, Watch), pattern (hover, dropdown, empty state…), industry or keyword.
  4. One-click preview – Comment contains a “View on Ripplix” link → opens the HD interaction with playback controls, frame counter and downloadable Lottie/CSS snippets.
  5. Zero bloat – Nothing is embedded in the Figma file except a tiny thumbnail + link, so your files stay light.


Typical Workflow

  1. Select a layer that needs motion polish.
  2. In the Ripplix sidebar search “hover + dropdown”.
  3. Preview candidates; click Add to Figma.
  4. A comment tag appears on your layer, click upon you can preview the motion.
  5. During hand-off, devs open the link, watch the real interaction, and build it confident they’re matching the reference.


Need help or want to suggest an animation we’re missing?

📧 support@ripplix.com


Install Ripplix → pin a motion reference → ship delightful, on-brand interactions—without another endless prototype.
plugins.tagline: Inspiring for better Interaction

plugins.name: Logify
plugins.description:
Logify — Version Tracking for Design Systems


Keep your design system consistent — and versioned. This plugin helps you track changes to local styles and components in your Figma file, presenting differences in a clean, structured changelog directly on the canvas.


No need to log edits manually — Logify detects added, modified, and removed elements automatically.


What you can do:

  1. Compare current and previous file states
  2. Generate visual changelogs inside your file
  3. Group updates by Added / Changed / Removed
  4. Document design system evolution clearly

accepted.name: Pavel Grachev
accepted.description: Product designer with 5+ years of experience in web and mobile UI. Focused on clarity, usability, and quality design systems.

plugins.tagline: Effortless changelog for your design system

plugins.name: Figma to Azure
plugins.description:
Crete Azure work items without leaving Figma.


Key Features

  1. One-Click Creation: Select any Figma component to generate an Azure Board item.
  2. Automatic Previews: Visuals attach directly to the work item.
  3. Direct Linking: Clickable links between Azure work items and components.
  4. Custom Field Mapping: Match your Azure setup with flexible field configs.
  5. Team Area Support: Organize work in your project’s structure.
  6. Smart Field Detection: Autofills required Azure fields.


Why Teams Use It

  1. Save time—no more screenshots or copy-paste.
  2. Developers get full visual context.
  3. Sync design and dev workflows effortlessly.
  4. Keep everything traceable and connected.


How to Get Started

  1. Select a Figma component
  2. Add your Azure Personal Access Token (requires Read & Write access for work items)
  3. Enter your Azure DevOps URL
  4. Customize the item
  5. Click Create


That’s it—the plugin handles previews, links, and field setup for you.
plugins.tagline: Crete Azure work items without leaving Figma

  6. Smart Field Detection: Autofills required Azure fields.


Why Teams Use It

  1. Save time—no more screenshots or copy-paste.
  2. Developers get full visual context.
  3. Sync design and dev workflows effortlessly.
  4. Keep everything traceable and connected.


How to Get Started

  1. Select a Figma component
  2. Add your Azure Personal Access Token (requires Read & Write access for work items)
  3. Enter your Azure DevOps URL
  4. Customize the item
  5. Click Create


That’s it—the plugin handles previews, links, and field setup for you.

plugins.description:
With the Consistify plugin, you can be be able to:


Detect Design Inconsistencies: Scan multiple frames for discrepancies in font styles, colors, buttons, iconography(coming soon), spacing, and navigation elements(coming soon) etc.


Get Visual Feedback: Receive clear, color-coded tags indicating inconsistencies, with direct frame references and numerical comparisons for easy analysis.


Streamline Workflow(coming soon): Highlight design issues directly in the UI, allowing users to click and focus on problematic frames, helping maintain design system integrity across projects.


To use the Consistify plugin, follow these steps:


Open your design in Figma.

Select at least 2 frames you want to compare for inconsistencies.

Run the Plugin

Accessibility Checker: Analyze contrast ratios in real-time for WCAG compliance.

Component Management: Identify duplicate components and track usage statistics.

The plugin is a must-have tool for ensuring cohesive, well-structured designs while saving time on manual checks.

plugins.name: PropSelect
plugins.description:
PropSelect enhances your Figma workflow by allowing you to copy and paste specific properties like fill, stroke, and corner radius between elements without overwriting all properties.


Here is a YouTube video summarizing the features and working of this plugin - https://youtu.be/76v9z9xthH0


How it works:

1. Select an element: Click on an element in your design, and its properties will appear in the plugin UI.

2. Choose properties to copy: For each property (e.g., fill, stroke, corner radius), you can select a checkbox to indicate which properties you want to copy. Once you're done, click the copy button to save the selected properties.

3. Paste properties: You can paste the copied properties onto one or more elements at once.


Features:

• Selective property copying: Choose exactly which properties to copy (e.g., fill, stroke, corner radius) to avoid overwriting unwanted styles.

• Multi-object pasting: Apply copied properties to multiple objects simultaneously, saving time when working with multiple elements.

• Compatibility with other methods: You can paste properties copied outside of the plugin directly. Copying properties within plugin will not override that.

• Undo support: Easily undo your last action if something goes wrong.


Tips:

• Use PropSelect to quickly replicate specific properties across multiple objects without affecting other styles.

• Perfect for maintaining consistency in your design while only changing the properties you care about.

• Works well for batch edits where you want to adjust specific properties, like color or stroke width, across many elements.


Known issues:

• Does not copy underline properties or text alignment.

• Will not work on text boxes with different properties applied to individual contents.
plugins.tagline: Copy and paste specific properties of an element

137698.release_notes:
This version includes 2 major updates - 
1. Initially, on copying a property having a 'style' only the raw value of style was getting copied. Now, it will copy the style itself. E.g. on copying a element with fill style `Black`, the value of that style i.e. #000000 was getting copied which is now fixed to paste `Black` as fill style.
2. The stroke property initially did not capture stroke stroke direction (all sides/ top/ left/ custom, etc) and would apply it on all sides. Fixed

Please let me know if you find any bugs or have suggestions to improve.

plugins.description:
BulkGen figma plugin saves you hundreds of hours of doing grunt work. If you're tasked with creating the same design, lots of time with just some data changing — don't wast time doing it manually. Just use bulkgen, it can auto populate your figma designs from a Google Sheet.


Features:

  1. Google Sheet Import: Make sure these are set to public.
  2. CSV Import: Works for local files


How it Works:

  1. Paste your Google Sheets URL
  2. Make sure the dynamic layers in Figma are labelled correctly (ex: firstname would be #firstname)
  3. Select a base template and hit generate, it's that easy.


Use Cases:

  1. Event Banners: Doing the same event in many cities? This will work for that
  2. Certificates: Automate 1000s of certificates in just a few clicks
  3. Wedding Invites: Mail Merge is so oldschool, just use this.
  4. And Many More.

plugins.name: Adapture by INKR
plugins.description:
Adapture makes it easy to adapt your designs for new markets—right inside Figma. By understanding your content and layout, it rewrites and translates text that fits seamlessly into your design and speaks to your audience.


No broken layouts, no manual fixes—just content that works.


Why Designers Love Adapture:


  1. Effortless Adaptation: Select your frames, set your goals, and let Adapture handle the rest. It rewrites and translates text while keeping your layout intact.
  2. Smarter Translations: Adapture analyzes your design and messaging to deliver text that matches the tone, intent, and purpose of your work.
  3. Consistent Messaging: Whether you’re creating for new audiences or adapting for different markets, Adapture helps you keep your messaging aligned and on-brand.
  4. Saves Time: Automates the heavy lifting so you can focus on creating, not fixing.


Key Features:


  1. Design-Aware Adaptation: Adapture understands your designs and rewrites text to fit your layout, intent, and audience.
  2. Cultural Customization: Adapt for new markets with sensitivity to language, tone, and local nuances.
  3. Built for Designers: Works right inside Figma, so you can adapt and update designs without disrupting your workflow.
  4. Seamless Integration: Keeps your layouts clean and intact, saving you time and effort.


Perfect For:


  1. Designers creating multilingual or culturally tailored content.
  2. Teams expanding into new markets or working across global audiences.
  3. Anyone who wants to streamline design adaptation without sacrificing quality.

plugins.name: get-antd-token
plugins.description:
# get-antd-token - Ant Design Token 匹配工具


## 简介


get-antd-token 是一个专为设计师和开发者打造的 Figma 插件，帮助您快速匹配 Figma 设计元素与 Ant Design 的设计 Token，实现无缝的设计与开发协作。


## 主要功能


- 🎨 **精准颜色匹配**：选择任意元素，即时获取对应的 Ant Design 颜色 Token

- 💧 **半透明颜色识别**：智能识别半透明颜色，并提供 `rgba(token.colorXXX, 0.x)` 格式的替代方案

- 🔍 **边框与内边距识别**：自动检测元素的圆角和内边距，匹配相应的 borderRadius 和 padding Token

- 📝 **模板管理系统**：支持导入/导出 Token 模板，完全兼容 Ant Design 的主题配置文件

- 🔄 **一键复制**：快速复制 Token 值，轻松粘贴到代码中


## 插件优势


- **提高设计开发效率**：不再需要手动查找颜色代码或测量边距

- **保持设计一致性**：确保使用 Ant Design 官方推荐的 Token

- **简化设计交接**：设计师可以直接提供 Token 名称而非色值

- **支持主题切换**：通过模板管理轻松在不同主题间切换
plugins.tagline: 支持选中figma的元素获取到antd主题色对应的token值

Your files are never stored on our servers — images are processed securely via the official TinyPNG API and delivered straight back to you.


Batch compress multiple images, preview results, and export everything with a single click.

Perfect for anyone who values speed, security, and high-quality image optimization.

137621.description:

Your files are never stored on our servers — images are processed securely via the official TinyPNG API and delivered straight back to you.


Batch compress multiple images, preview results, and export everything with a single click.

networkAccess.reasoning: The plugin uses TinyPNG API for image compression. Since TinyPNG API doesn't support CORS directly, we use a CORS proxy (cors.siteceterum.ru) for secure API communication.

Double-click to jump to problem layers and get instant updates as you fix them—ensuring a smooth animation workflow.


How to Use Lighthouse:

1️⃣ Select a Frame – Open Lighthouse and choose a frame to analyze.

2️⃣ Instant Issue Detection – View a list of unsupported animation features.

3️⃣ Quick Fix Navigation – Double-click an issue to select the affected layer.

4️⃣ Live Updates – Changes update instantly as you fix issues.

5️⃣ Final Check & Export – Ensure compatibility for seamless Lottie animations.

6️⃣ Mark frames – Mark frames that are ready for animation to avoid confusion and ensure efficient workflow.


Simplify your motion design process with Lighthouse! 🚀

plugins.name: The Settler — localiser for external (or missing) alias variables
plugins.description:
(Русский внизу 👇)

en:

This plugin localises all alias variables that refer to missing base variables (those located in external files or simply deleted)

🎦 Video demonstration: https://youtu.be/f9Ofv7lB-Lk


Why is this a problem?! Figma doesn't care about these links, it doesn't transfer them to the new file, but leaves the links to the companion variables (base/master variables) in the old file. And this isn't what you expect when you copy variables :)


In simple words, what the plugin does:

  1. It looks for alias variables that have a reference to base variables that didn't make it to this file (either left in another file or simply missing)
  2. Creates copies of such variables in this file
  3. Rebinds the alias variable, changing the reference from the external master variable (base variable) to the newly created local one


Works for variables of all types:

  1. color,
  2. text,
  3. boolean,
  4. numeric

It should work with multiple mods, but I haven't tested this part.


ru:

Плагин поможет, когда вы взяли и "тупа" скопировали переменные из другого файла, а там были алиасы (переменные ссылались на другие переменные).

🎦 Видео-демонстрация: https://youtu.be/f9Ofv7lB-Lk

Но вот незадача! Figma не заботиться об этих связях, она не переносит их в новый файл, а оставляет ссылки на переменные-спутники (базовые/мастер-переменные) в старом файле. А это вообще не то, чего ждёшь, когда копируешь переменные :)


Простыми словами, что делает плагин:

  1. Ищет переменные-алиасы, которые ссылаются на базовые переменные, не дошедшие до этого файла (либо оставшиеся в другом файле, либо пропавшие без вести)
  2. Создает копии таких переменных в этом файле
  3. Перевязывает алиас-переменную, меняя ссылку с внешней мастер-переменной (базовой переменной) на локальную


Работает для переменных всех типов:

  1. цветовые,
  2. текстовые,
  3. булевы,
  4. числовые


По идее, должно работает и с множественными модами, но я не тестил этот момент

accepted.name: Studio The
accepted.description:
The UX/UI designer,
The Motion designer

plugins.name: Selemander Curreny

You can convert the selected numbers into currency units by country.

You can search for the currency you want to convert by searching by country name or currency code, or you can extract only numbers.

Only currency symbols and codes can be added separately,

You can also convert the Korean number to a Korean number unit or convert the Korean number back to an Arabic number.

You can enter only by collecting currency symbols.

plugins.name: Condens
plugins.description:
With the Condens plugin, you can quickly import highlights from Condens into FigJam. This keeps your insights intact, preserving key details like participant names and links back to the original data.


Perfect for brainstorming, organizing ideas, and running synthesis workshops with your team — without losing the context behind your research, even when switching between tools.

  3. Your Highlights are instantly converted into sticky notes, complete with the respondent’s name and a direct link back to the original data in Condens, ready to use in your FigJam board.


Contact us for support, book a demo to get a personalized walkthrough, or visit our Help Center for more information.

plugins.name: EasyMemo
plugins.description:
EasyMemo is a versatile plugin for creating, editing, and managing text memos within Figma. With EasyMemo, you can easily add colorful sticky notes, shapes with text, and simple text nodes to your canvas, helping to keep your workspace organized.


Key Features:


Memo Creation and Editing: Simply enter your text, select your desired memo type, and create memos effortlessly. You can edit memos directly on the canvas, and updates are reflected in real-time.

Customizable Colors: Choose colors from a preset color palette, allowing you to categorize and prioritize memos. The text color automatically adjusts for optimal readability based on the selected background color.

Easy Management:


Organize Memos in a List: Add memos to a list for better organization. You can update or delete memo texts directly from the list. The list is scrollable and always up-to-date.

Batch Generation: Easily generate all listed memos at once. Just click the "Create Shapes" button, and all memos will be neatly arranged on the canvas.

Efficient Layout: Memos are generated in the center of the viewport, focusing on the most relevant areas. They are neatly arranged to avoid overlap.

User-Friendly Interface: The modern and intuitive design features a clearly laid-out text input area, radio buttons for selecting memo types, a color palette, and a dynamically updating list.

How to Use:


Enter Text: Input your memo content in the text input area.

Select Memo Type: Choose from shapes with text, simple text, or sticky notes using the radio buttons.

Pick a Color: Select a color from the palette to categorize your memos. The selected color applies to the memo background, and the text color adjusts automatically.

Add to List: Press the Enter key to add the memo to the list. You can edit or delete memos directly within the list.

Generate Memos: Click the "Create Shapes" button to generate all memos on the canvas at once. Memos are centered in the viewport and neatly arranged.

EasyMemo is the perfect tool for organizing ideas and feedback within your Figma projects. Whether brainstorming, planning, or collaborating, EasyMemo simplifies memo management and supports you efficiently.
plugins.tagline: メモやテキストをEnterキー押下のみでリスト化して一括でShape,テキスト、Stickyを生成するプラグインです

plugins.name: Tazym
plugins.description:
Introducing Tazym, the ultimate Figma plugin that streamlines the design-to-web process. With Tazym, you can effortlessly upload your designs to the cloud, generating a unique URL that allows you to update your design in Figma in real-time. Say goodbye to manual website updates or the need to rely on developers. With Tazym, you are the creator, and you own your designs.


Getting started with Tazym is easy. Simply select your design, name it, choose a format (SVG, PNG, or JPG), and voila - you have a URL that can be used anywhere to showcase your work. When inspiration strikes and you want to make updates, it's as easy as editing in Figma and hitting the Update button in Tazym. Your users will see your latest creations instantly.


Ready to take control of your designs and streamline your workflow? Visit tazym.com to learn more and start using Tazym today!
